data.title: Big Tech CEOs Head Back to Capitol Hill
data.text: The chief executive officers of Amazon.com Inc., Facebook Inc., Alphabet Inc. and Apple will testify on July 27 before a U.S. congressional panel investigating competition in the technology industry. Rep. Ken Buck, a Republican from Colorado, discusses the House Judiciary Antitrust Subcommittee's investigation. He speaks on "Bloomberg Technology."

data.title: Alphabet’s Loon uses balloon to give internet to remote regions in Kenya
data.text: Alphabet began offering the world’s first commercial high-speed internet using balloons to villagers in remote regions of Kenya’s Rift Valley on Wednesday. “Kenya is the first country… to have base stations high up in the sky.

data.title: Barry Diller Says Google Needs Regulation, Won't Join Facebook Ad Boycott
data.text: Barry Diller, chairman and senior executive of Expedia Group Inc. and IAC/InterActive Corp., discusses his views on big tech monopolies and the movement to boycott advertising on Facebook. Diller speaks exclusively with Bloomberg's Erik Schatzker on "Front Row."

data.title: What To Expect From Comms Sector Earnings? It’s Still A Guesstimate
data.text: Fasten your seat belts. Tightly! As Q2 earnings reports begin trickling in, investors everywhere should prepare for what one headline writer called “The Ugliest Earnings Season since the Financial Crisis.

data.title: 4 Self-Driving Car Stocks to Buy For the Long Haul
data.text: Self-driving car stocks will be in limelight in the coming years as growth gains traction. Names like Tesla are among the front-runners.

data.title: Google launches the Open Usage Commons, a new organization for managing open-source trademarks
data.text: Google, in collaboration with a number of academic leaders and its consulting partner SADA Systems, today announced the launch of the Open Usage Commons, a new organization that aims to help open-source projects manage their trademarks. To be fair, at first glance, open-source trademarks may not sound like it would be a major problem (or […]

data.title: Facebook, Apple, Amazon, and Alphabet CEOs to Testify in Congress This Month
data.text: The House Judiciary antitrust subcommittee is very interested in what the quartet has to say about market dominance and competition.

data.title: Deutsche Bank Enters Multi-Year Partnership With Google Cloud
data.text: Deutsche Bank (DB) seeks to better cater to the needs of customers by introducing innovative technology solutions in partnership with Google Cloud.

data.title: NVIDIA's (NVDA) Ampere A100 GPUs to Debut on Google Cloud
data.text: Alphabet's Google Cloud becomes the first cloud-service provider to offer NVDIA's (NVDA) flagship server GPU -- Ampere A100.

data.title: Google's Deal With Deutsche Bank to Bolster Cloud Presence
data.text: Alphabet's (GOOGL) Google has agreed to partner with Deutsche Bank in a bid to expand its cloud customer base.

data.title: Google And Amazon Are Inadvertently Funding Covid Conspiracy Sites To The Tune Of $25 Million
data.text: Researchers are urging tech giants to close the “funding back door” that inadvertently funnels advertising money to sites sharing misinformation.

data.title: Alphabet's Loon starts beaming internet from balloons in Kenya
data.text: Loon said its balloon-powered internet service will initially cover 50,000 square kilometers in western and central parts of Kenya.
